creator: wink@usgs.gov
text:
We have a group who find the server-status information useful in debugging their
application.  But the limited number of characters displayed of the URL is a
barrier.  If I modify "char request[64]" in the short_score structure in
scoreboard.h, will that a) acomplish what I want or b) create other severe
problems?  In Apache 2.0, the structure is "worker_score" in the same header file.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
change to larger number in your environment; re-compile Apache httpd as well as
any 3rd-party modules that access the scoreboard...  strictly speaking you'd be
breaking binary compatibility, but if you can recompile any 3rd-party modules
you use, you won't have a problem

this isn't the place for Q&A, but you noticed that already since nobody
responded in 7 months :)

Thanks for using Apache!
